All offers of employment are contingent upon successful completion of all pre-employment screenings.
Immunization Requirements
Under Policy 100.3.1 Immunization Policy for Covered Individuals, if employment will commence during Flu Season, Rutgers University may require certain prospective employees to provide proof that they are vaccinated against Seasonal Influenza for the current Flu Season, unless the University has granted the individual a medical or religious exemption. Additional infection control and safety policies may apply. Prospective employees should speak with their hiring manager to determine which policies apply to the role or position for which they are applying. Failure to provide proof of vaccination for any required vaccines or obtain a medical or religious exemption from the University will result in rescission of a candidate’s offer of employment or disciplinary action up to and including termination.

title: Assistant Auxilliary Plant Operator
description:
**Are we RIGHT for you?**


The word RIGHT stands for what we VALUE: Respect, Integrity, Growth, Honesty and Teamwork.


**Why join our team?**


Middlesex Water Company (NASDAQ:MSEX) has been an industry leader since 1897. We promote professional and personal development in a work environment that is supportive and responsive. We understand the importance of our services and the individuals who uphold our reputation.


Joining our team means that you have a multitude of benefits that support you in and out of the workplace such as- full medical, dental, and vision benefits, 401k, paid time off, tuition assistance, learning and development opportunities, employee assistance program, and more. To learn more, please visit www.middlesexwater.com


**Job Summary:**


The Auxiliary Assistant Plant Operator maintains, monitors, and operates production facilities and distribution system pressures utilizing both computer and manual instrumentation. This position assists the maintenance staff as scheduled. The successful candidate will be passionate about supporting and driving the Company’s Values, RIGHT: Respect, Integrity, Growth, Honesty and Teamwork.


**Work Performed:**


* Assist the Plant Operator in the maintenance and monitoring of distribution system pressures and water storage tank levels.
* Assist the Plant Operator in the monitoring and maintenance of flow to the wholesale customers.
* Assist the Plant Operator in operating booster pumps, well fields, auxiliary pumping station, inter-connections and isolation, and flow reducing valves.
* Assist the Plant Operator in operating pumps at the CJO Plant Intake Station in order to meet CJO Plant effluent flow requirements.
* Assist the Plant Operator in monitoring and maintaining the water treatment process through the addition and adjustment of water treatment chemicals in order to meet changing raw water quality, operation, and monitoring of the filter backwash system and the maintenance of hydraulic flow through the plant.
* Perform laboratory testing as required to monitor the treatment process.
* Perform plant, well field, and distribution system record keeping.
* Perform CJO Plant equipment and security checks as scheduled.
* Assist the Plant Operator in the response to plant facility, distribution system alarm, emergencies and crisis situations through contact with on-call supervision and established emergency and crisis management procedures.
* Handle customer inquiries, complaints, and problems in a courteous and polite manner through contact with various on-call personnel.
* Assist Maintenance staff during the day shift as scheduled in the current operator schedule.
* At the discretion of the Superintendent of Production, the Auxiliary Assistant Plant Operator may be required to fill in on odd shifts as required or needed.
* Work rotating shifts, weekends, and holidays as scheduled or needed.


Note: Some mandatory overtime will be required as necessary to maintain facilities operation.


* Prepare maintenance work requests as equipment issues or situations arise so they can be repaired.
* Perform chemical receiving at CJO Treatment Plant and designated remote facilities and safe handling of 150# chlorine cylinders.
* Perform other related duties as required by supervisor.
* Adhere to and promote the Company safety policy and practices as it pertains to the job.


**Qualifications:**


* High school diploma or equivalent, required.
* Must have the ability to obtain T-1 license within four years of date of employment.
* Must maintain a valid NJ driver's license.


**Americans With Disabilities Act:**


* The work is typically performed while intermittently sitting, standing, walking, stopping, crouching or bending.
* The employee frequently lifts light or heavy objects, uses tools and equipment requiring a high degree of dexterity, distinguishes between shades of color and utilizes the sense of smell.
* The work is typically performed while indoors or outdoors, sometimes in cold inclement weather. The employee is exposed to noise, dust, dirt, grease, hazardous chemicals, and machinery with moving parts.
* The work requires the use of protective devices such as masks, goggles, gloves, etc.


**Candidates must possess authorization to work in the United States.**


**Candidates must be able to pass a drug screen, pre-employment physical, background check, and have a valid driver’s license.**


**No phone calls please. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those applicants who are being considered for the position, or are currently employed by Middlesex Water Company will be contacted.**

**Middlesex Water Company and its' subsidiaries are an Equal Opportunity Employer.**
company_description: Middlesex Water Company offers employee health benefits such as Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Tuition Reimbursement, and more!

title: Dental Billing Specialist
description:
We seek a talented, self-motivated dental billing associate with a thirst for knowledge to enhance skills to help develop. Are you prepared to help develop and build the dental billing infrastructure, technology, and tools to measure your achievements? We are a clinician owned Pediatric Dental Group with locations throughout the NY-NJ-VT Metro areas. Our professional leadership is here to guide your career development and support your evolving dental Revenue Cycle expertise. You could make a difference in the lives of children we serve and develop your next career pathway.

**POSITION SUMMARY:**

* Revenue Cycle Specialist (Dental Billing / Collections) works with the Program Director and Revenue Cycle Leadership to refine billing & collection operations.
* Support accurate documentation of patient financial records and financing plans
* Support payer treatment authorization and appeals
* Support office associates in managing patient balances for ongoing treatment adjustments
* Works collaboratively with Office Managers, Finance, and Partners to ensure timely billing, cash reconciliation, remittance adjustments, and insurance A/R management.
* Use of crucial reporting solutions for managing work product through open collaboration with leadership and peers
* Develop regulatory knowledge with payer plan eligibility requirements to resolve issues
* Recommend methods to reduce denials, improve clean claim processes, and maximize reimbursement through automation and process efficiencies.
* **POSITION REQUIREMENTS**:
* Minimum 1 year of Dental billing, A/R, or Patient account management.
* Expertise with Dentrix, Practice Management, Digital Radiography, & Payer Portals.
* Practical experience using MS Excel, Word, Network File Use, and Secure Email.
* Delivery of detailed work product with focused accuracy.
* Excellent time management and organization skills; ability to prioritize own workload and multitask effectively and independently.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**:

* Duties and responsibilities may vary by office; including but not limited to:
* Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures, as well as state and federal regulations.
* Research, review, evaluate, and resolve billing process issues and revenue collections.
* Coordinate with office stakeholders to resolve unbilled procedures.
* Identify and correct claim rejections for clean claim submission.
* Reconcile payments to billing with appropriate adjustment assignment.
* Ensure that accounts receivable is accurate and up to date.
* Accomplish department objectives by measuring billing results against budget, evaluating and improving methods, making required or appropriate changes.
* Ensures timely collection of revenue by resolving billing issues; maintaining customer relations

Benefits

* Competitive Compensation
* Comprehensive Benefits
* 401K
* Paid vacations and holidays
* Comprehensive training to advance your dental career advancement

**About Us**


HQRC stands for Highest Quality, Rigorous Compliance.


And that's what we and our affiliated pediatric dental practices focus on every day.


We provide all of the management and administrative services to pediatric dental practices located throughout the Northeast, including many areas with underserved populations.


While we take care of the administrative aspects of managing an office, our affiliated dental practices can provide the highest quality care with rigorous compliance and invest in the latest technologies and innovations that benefit their patients. The dental offices also aim to provide a comfortable and enjoyable dental experience for all children.
company_description: The dental practices we serve are seeking talented, caring individuals to provide unsurpassed dental services to the children in their communities.

title: Director, Strategic Planning - VP
description:
### **Basic Information**

Location
NY NY 622 3rd
Posted Date
14-Aug-2024
Agency
Neon
Department
Strategic Planning
Job Number
43969
Job Type
Regular
Posting Locations
United States - New York, New York
Work Arrangement
Regular - Hybrid
### **Job Description**

  

**JOB SUMMARY**


The Director, Strategic Planning, VP is a seasoned brand builder and client-facing planning lead with a strong track record of managing complex accounts and pitches. They possess exceptional strategic storytelling skills and the ability to guide insight generation and campaign development. With a talent for quickly building personal equity and establishing themselves as a strategic leader, they excel in taking on new and possibly more challenging accounts, leading new business and attending pitch presentations. Seen as a leader within the department, they are responsible for the supervision and career development of multiple levels of talent.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

**Brand Planning**

* Expert in strategic discipline, agency processes and pharma compliance requirements.
* Translates market dynamics, customer insights and deep understanding of disease state to developing brand strategy and solving brand challenges.
* Displays strong story telling skills and voice as it relates to written strategy skills.
* New business leadership and pitch attendance.

**Client Management**

* Displays strategic leadership and facilitation of large and bespoke client workshops and brainstorming sessions.
* Drives influence toward a strategic POV and recommendation internally and with more senior clients.
* Serves as consultant to client on market research design, methodologies, and analysis.
* Strong strategic voice, driving clarification, direction, and leadership of internal and/or client meetings.

**Cross Functional Collaboration**

* Lead strategic planning responsibilities on multiple brands, integrated accounts, with autonomy and proficiency.
* Partner with other agency departments to ensure pull through of insights and strategy.
* Talent Management & Development
* Supervise and develop lower-level staff and delegate incoming tasks and assignments as appropriate.
* Responsible for hiring and staffing decisions and full life-cycle talent management (eg, delivering feedback, annual reviews, general and performance management)

**JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Execute expert level understanding of the strategic planning fundamentals of disease state, indications, customer and science of assigned brands.
* Lead strategic planning responsibilities on multiple large and small accounts, new business and/or support senior planners on larger, integrated accounts, with autonomy and proficiency.
* Leads full suite of brand strategy deliverables (positioning, bedrock, creative briefs/briefings, message strategy, tactical planning) and mentor junior team members to achieve success.
* Market research expertise and consulting; drive insight mining/ideation to uncover strategic opportunities and inform and strengthen creative.
* Expert in planning tools and core competencies, driving proper use; positioning, insight generation and creative brief writing.
* Leadership of new business; immersion insight gathering, storytelling, strategy development and tactic pull throughand attendance.
* Strategic leadership and facilitation of large, complex and bespoke client workshops and/or brainstorm sessions.
* Directly supervises Director and Associate Director levels on brand(s), and provides mentorship/guidance to team as needed.
* Meets regularly with direct and indirect reports to proactively manage career development.
* Responsible for hiring, staffing, career development, and full life-cycle talent management for direct team (eg, delivering feedback, annual reviews, general and performance management).
* Demonstrates leadership, empathy and professionalism in communications.


COMPETENCIES* Communication
* Expresses ideas accurately, concisely, and clearly.
* Curiosity
* Displays eagerness in learning and asks thought-provoking questions.
* Passion
* Demonstrates investment and commitment to brands, clients, teams, and assignments.
* Organization
* Creates clear goals, identifies, and finds the resources (eg, time, people, materials) needed to achieve them, and schedules tasks so that work is completed on time.
* Collaboration
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment to build and foster positive relationships, trust and confidence.
* Agility
* Ability to change directions quickly and think on your feet.
* Forward Thinking
* Focused on short term wins as well as building towards long-term success.
* Problem-Solving
* Shows interest in finding the cause of problems, looks for and chooses effective solutions, and takes the necessary action to resolve them.
* Assumption Challenger
* Challenge assumptions and traditional ways of doing things to bring disruptive strategies and new ideas to brands.
* Influence
* Presents in a way to command and influence key and relevant stakeholders.
* Accountability
* Drive and motivates team towards actionable results. Keep themselves honest in effective output.
 **QUALIFICATIONS**

**EDUCATION**


Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications or Related Field Preferred

**EXPERIENCE**


8+ years in Brand strategy or market research in an agency setting preferred

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES**

* Competent in software specific to the client and agency processes including Microsoft Word, Teams, PowerPoint, Excel.
* Excellent working knowledge in research tools (search databases including SERMO, Datamonitor).
* Excellent working knowledge in social media platforms.
* Excellent oral and written communication.
* Excellent strategic thinking and analytical skills; triangulate insights and data from multiple
* sources/departments/agency. partners to analyze and solve problems.
* Able to work on multiple projects, adhere to timeline and maintain organization.
* Ability to use AI platforms as an accelerant for brand needs and strategic deliverables.
* Strong understanding of agency offerings, services, products and solutions.
* Expert level understanding of brand/pharma marketing and promotional strategy and trends (customer, industry,innovation).


SALARY


$160,000 to $230,000 annually


The salary range for this position is noted within this job posting. Where an employee or prospective employee is paid within this range will depend on, among other factors, actual ranges for current/former employees in the subject position; market considerations; budgetary considerations; tenure and standing with the company (applicable to current employees); as well as the employee’s/applicant’s background, pertinent experience, and qualifications.

EOE/AA/M/D/V/F.

title: Sales Leader
description:
***Are you a proven leader with an ability to communicate successfully across all levels of an organization? Do you pride yourself on your knowledge of the energy industry? Are you looking for a role that allows you to develop strategy and see it through? If so, we want you to join our team!***


The Sales Leader develops strategic plans to ensure consistent, profitable growth in sales revenue for the East Business Unit (BU); provides direct leadership, management and coaching to the BU sales team; and actively manages performance to ensure sales results. The Sales Leader works to secure new business, develops growth plans, and is ultimately accountable to ensuring the BU sales goal is met and/or exceeded for Regional Sales including MUSH, C&I, Performance Contracting, etc. across a variety of energy scopes.

*Looking for someone to be in the Mid Atlantic, PA, NY or New England* *and a desire to travel throughout the Business Unit territory.*


Our Sales Leader contributes to the team by:

* Being accountable for achieving or exceeding the Business Unit sales goal in partnership with the Business Unit Manager
* Providing direct leadership, management and coaching to the BU sales team (Account Executives) and ensures that individual performance is actively managed in accordance to Centrica Business Solutions practices at all levels within the team
* Developing a sales team (Account Executive) staffing plan and the talent acquisition functions for optimal hiring and retention
* Coordinating resources to ensure stable sales results, including lead generation and pipeline development
* Collaborating with the Business Unit Manager and Marketing team to establish and control budgets for marketing collateral, outreach programs and trade show expenses.
* Collaborating with other Business Unit sales teams
* Working with a cross-functional team consisting of finance, operations, engineering and marketing to secure new business and influence Business Unit and Company strategy
* Developing and taking ownership of market growth plans, including vertical market targeting and horizontal offering strategies as well as expansion into new geographical territories
* Understanding competitors within designated regional market in order to position Centrica Business Solutions’ unique approach, capabilities and offerings
* Assisting sales team (Account Executives) in establishing relationships with top echelon decision-makers
* Negotiating comprehensive energy projects with clients at the executive level and facilities staff level within their organization, as required
* Leading customer meetings, presentations, and contract negotiations, as required
* Cultivating and fostering customer relationships
* Working with Account Executives to ensure accurate data is entered and maintained in Centrica Business Solutions’ CRM software

  

The **core components** needed to be successful in this role are (i.e. must haves):

* At least 7 years’ successfully executing sales and/or marketing strategies (Account Executive) for an HVAC controls contractor, mechanical contractor, energy services company or a related organization
* Demonstrated ability to successfully communicate across all ‘levels’ of an organization
* Ability to make timely and effective decisions; produce results through strategic planning and evaluation

  

The following are a definite **plus**, so if you’ve got any of these be sure to tell us!

* At least 5 years’ effectively managing people/teams
* Bachelor’s degree Engineering, Business, Construction Management or a related field

 **Our Team and Culture:**

  

We offer a culture filled with collaboration, passion, reliability, trustworthiness and more! We don’t just talk the talk but we actually walk to walk here and can show this through our employee feedback – check it our yourself to see what employees are saying:

* High level of employee engagement
* Trust in leadership

* Wellbeing
* Employees feeling valued

 **What we do:**

  

Digitalization and climate change mean organizations need to be more energy efficient and resilient to limit their impact on the environment while maintaining control of their energy spend**.**

  

At Centrica Business Solutions, we deliver integrated energy solutions that balance profitability and sustainability.

  

By bringing together the right combination of technologies and approaches, we help organizations get the most value from their energy and energy infrastructure, helping them solve their energy challenges and harness new opportunities in a changing world. As an Energy Service Company (ESCO), our broad portfolio includes:

* Energy Efficiency Solutions including HVAC, lighting, controls, building envelope, water
* Solar and Energy Storage
* Electric vehicle and battery storage solutions

 **Our benefits and perks:**

  

At Centrica Business Solutions, we ensure you are supported and valued. To help do this, we offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. Some of our benefits & perks include:

title: Rooftop Solar Installer
description:
***Do you want to work for a company where your work matters? What if you could have a direct impact on customer satisfaction? Do you enjoy traveling and being able to work on different job sites? If so, we want you on our team!***


The Rooftop Solar Installer will play a significant role in the installation of solar panels and related components on commercial structures.


Our Rooftop Solar Installer contributes to the team by:

* Configuring, installing, inspecting, and maintaining Solar PV Systems for commercial customers as well as assessing the installation environment to identify and address any potential hazards and taking necessary steps to mitigate them.
* Accurately mapping out the placement of components based on provided diagrams and ensuring the system is effectively sealed against weather conditions, following safety codes and manufacturer specifications.
* As lead by the Lead Installer, conducting thorough testing and recording results. If adjustments or corrections are deemed necessary, follow the Lead Installers remediation suggestions.
* Assisting the Lead Installer in building systems as designed on the Issued for Construction Drawing set.
* Accurately labeling installing, and terminating electrical wiring and/or connections.
* Maintaining open and effective communication with subordinate supervisory personnel, regarding all activities within each job while ensuring occupational health and safety of all Centrica employees, subcontractors, project teams, clients, guests and assets in accordance with local, state and federal regulations, departmental and company policies, as well as industry standards and practices.
* Maintaining and promoting an organized job site and/or working environment.
* Maintaining current and valid certifications as required by Centrica and deemed necessary by safety, local, state, and federal laws.

  

The **core components** needed to be successful in this role are (i.e. must haves):

* At least 2 years’ experience working in the Commercial Solar Industry
* Proficient in the use of basic hand and power tools
* Fall protection training and the use of fall arrest harnesses and equipment
* Critical thinking and problem solving skills with the ability to effectively work in a team environment
* Ability to demonstrate exemplary worth ethics
* High School Diploma or equivalent
* Active Driver’s License and clean driving record

  

The following are a definite **plus**, so if you’ve got any of these be sure to tell us!

* Trade school or technical training
* OSHA 10

  

This is not your average 9am – 5pm position. If you are someone who enjoys traveling and seeing new places this job is for you! **Our Rooftop Installers need to have scheduling flexibility with an ability to travel to different jobsites.**

 **Our Team and Culture:**

  

We offer a culture filled with collaboration, passion, reliability, trustworthiness and more! We don’t just talk the talk but we actually walk to walk here and can show this through our employee feedback – check it our yourself to see what employees are saying:

  

* High level of employee engagement
* Trust in leadership
* Senior leaders listen and act
* Wellbeing
* Employees feeling valued
* Strong focus in health and safety
* Strategy & direction

At Centrica Business Solutions, we deliver integrated energy solutions that balance profitability and sustainability.

As an Energy Service Company (ESCO), our broad portfolio includes:

* Energy Efficiency Solutions including HVAC, lighting, controls, building envelope, water
* Solar and Energy Storage
* Electric vehicle and battery storage solutions

 **Our benefits and perks:**

  

At Centrica Business Solutions, we ensure you are supported and valued. To help do this, we offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. Some of our benefits & perks include:

* Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
* HSA, with company match
* FSA/DCA
* Paid Time Off
* 401(k), with company match
* Life Insurance
* Accident Insurance
* Employee Wellness Program
* Fitness Reward Program
* Employee Training and Development Opportunities

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $20.00-$30.00/hr + benefits. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location and expectations during the hiring process. --------------------

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Facilities/Environmental/Maintenance
  

**Department** IPO-Envir. Services-New Bruns.
  

**Overview**
The Division of Institutional Planning & Operations (IP&O) employs a workforce of approximately 2,700 staff, represented by 15 collective negotiations agreements, and is responsible for institutional strategic initiatives and operations, which encompasses an expansive range of comprehensive service and business operations across the State of New Jersey. These include planning and construction, facilities, public safety and emergency operations, environmental health and safety, transportation, housing, and auxiliary/retail operations.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Environmental Svc Worker PT for the Division of Institutional Planning & Operations (IP&O). The primary purpose of the Environmental Services worker is to perform various tasks to maintain a clean, safe, sanitary an attractive environment.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Performs proper cleaning to insure cleanliness of the assigned areas.
* Performs routine and general cleaning to prevent the spread of infection and keeps areas orderly and attractive.
* Performs Isolation cleaning procedures as instructed in order to prohibit the spread of infection.
* Performs hard floor care and various levels of carpet care.
* Renders moving services throughout the University.
* Performs daily collection, storage and disposal of various waste generated within the University.
* Performs functional set ups according to requests.
* Performs various grounds cleaning tasks.
* Performs snow removal tasks.
* Operates University vehicles and vehicular equipment.
* Presents a clean uniform appearance.
* Performs final check and clean up at end of shift.
* Understands and adheres to Rutgers’ compliance standards as they appear in Rutgers’ Corporate Compliance Policy, Corporate Integrity Agreement, Code of Conduct, Conflict of Interest Policy and HiPAA.
* Interacts with persons of all ages in a diverse, multicultural environment with respect and consideration.
* Complies with the attendance policies of Rutgers and the Environmental Services Department in order to fulfill the responsibilities of the position.

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Prior experience in institutional environmental services is preferred.
* Valid driver’s license is preferred.


  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
**Physical Demands:**The person in this position must be physically active. Position requires climbing or balance, taste or smell less than 1/3 of the time; stand, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl, talk or hear up to 2/3 of the time; walking 2/3 of the time; reaching with hands and arms over 2/3 of the time. Position requires lifting up to ten (10) pounds over 2/3 of the time, lifting or exerting force of 25 pounds up to 2/3 of the time, lifting or exerting force of 50 or more pounds under 1/3 of the time. Position requires Close vision, Distance vision, Color vision, and Depth Perception. Ability to hear pager alerts, overhead pager radio messages.  

  

**Work Environment**: Up to 2/3 of the time, the position requires exposure to wet or humid conditions (non-weather), exposure to bloodborne pathogens that requires the use of Personal Protective Equipment, exposure to dust, fumes or airborne particles, and exposure to toxic or caustic chemicals that require the use of Personal Protective Equipment, exposure to outdoor weather conditions. Less than 1/3 of the time the position requires exposure to risk of electrical shock, exposure to risk of radiation, exposure to hazardous waste. The position requires work near moving mechanical parts up to 2/3 of the time, work in precarious places less than 1/3 of the time. The typical amounts of noise for the position are moderate to loud noise.

title: Account Executive
description:
***Do you thrive in an innovative environment? Do you enjoy being able to take the time to find other people’s concerns and offer solutions? Are you looking for an environment where your hard work and motivation is valued and rewarded? If so, we want you to join our team!***


The Account Executive will sell multi-million dollar energy optimization projects in a designated territory by identifying, assessing and structuring technical and financial solutions for customers such as municipalities and public K-12 schools. The Account Executive will require a strong technical background and the communication/business skills to translate customer needs into a strategic approach for our development and implementation teams.

*Open to flexible work schedules working fully remote or hybrid but must be able to travel up to 50% of the time. Looking for someone to be in New York, New England, Virginia, or Pennsylvania.*  

We promote a FlexFirst approach which empowers our employees to take ownership of their work and maintain a positive work/life balance.

  

Our Account Executive’s contributions to the team include:

* Identifying potential customers for design build energy efficiency, solar, battery storage and EV charging solutions in the municipality, university, hospital, and K-12 and higher education facility markets
* Calling on aforementioned customer base and develop sales strategy to successfully close project sales
* Working with a cross-functional team consisting of Engineering, Project Management, and Project Development team members
* Overseeing the development and delivery of projects which promote customer service and lead to long term relationships with clients
* Developing project technical write-ups, proposals, reports and presentations

  

The **core components** of success are (i.e. must haves):

* 3+ years of work experience in sales and marketing for a HVAC controls contractor, mechanical contractor, energy services company or related organization
* Experience in identifying leads, closing sales, and working with a project development team

  

The following are a definite **plus**, so if you’ve got it be sure to tell us!

* Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Engineering, Construction Management, Business or a related field
* Past experience and an up-to-date knowledge of best practices as they relate to upgrading and reducing energy consumption in building mechanical, electrical and plumbing (MEP) systems

* Operates University vehicles and vehicular equipment.
* Presents a clean uniform appearance.

* Understands and adheres to Rutgers’ compliance standards as they appear in Rutgers’ Corporate Compliance Policy, Corporate Integrity Agreement, Code of Conduct, Conflict of Interest Policy and HiPAA.
* Interacts with persons of all ages in a diverse, multicultural environment with respect and consideration.
* Complies with the attendance policies of Rutgers and the Environmental Services Department in order to fulfill the responsibilities of the position.

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* **Physical Demands**: The person in this position must be physically active. Position requires climbing or balance, taste or smell less than 1/3 of the time; stand, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl , talk or hear up to 2/3 of the time; walking 2/3 of the time; reaching with hands and arms over 2/3 of the time. Position requires lifting up to ten (10) pounds over 2/3 of the time, lifting or exerting force of 25 pounds up to 2/3 of the time, lifting or exerting force of 50 or more pounds under 1/3 of the time. Position requires Close vision, Distance vision, Color vision and Depth Perception. Ability to hear pager alerts, overhead pager radio messages.

  

* **Work Environment:** Up to 2/3 of the time, the position requires exposure to wet or humid conditions (non-weather), exposure to bloodborne pathogens that requires the use of Personal Protective Equipment, exposure to dust, fumes or airborne particles, and exposure to toxic or caustic chemicals that require the use of Personal Protective Equipment, exposure to outdoor weather conditions. Less than 1/3 of the time the position requires exposure to risk of electrical shock, exposure to risk of radiation, exposure to hazardous waste. The position requires work near moving mechanical parts up to 2/3 of the time, work in precarious places less than 1/3 of the time. The typical amounts of noise for the position are moderate to loud noise.

title: Operations Area Manager
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Operations Area Manager
  

**Job Category** URA-AFT Administrative
  

**Department** IPO-Facilities Maintenance-NB
  

**Overview**
The Division of Institutional Planning & Operations (IP&O) employs a workforce of approximately 2,700 staff, represented by 15 collective negotiations agreements, and is responsible for institutional strategic initiatives and operations, which encompasses an expansive range of comprehensive service and business operations across the State of New Jersey. These include planning and construction, facilities, public safety and emergency operations, environmental health and safety, transportation, housing, and auxiliary/retail operations.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking an Operations Area Manager for the Division of Institutional Planning & Operations (IP&O). Under the direction of and reporting to the Associate Director Facilities Maintenance and in conjunction with Planner Estimator, manages, plans, estimates and issues work orders for the day-to-day repair, maintenance, preventative maintenance, and minor alterations for buildings under his/her purview.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Mentors, motivates and supervises a variety of craft personnel overseeing behavior (attendance, compliance with University and Department guidelines etc), investigative activities, repair, and maintenance.
* Actively participates in planning of renovations, additions, outside vendors and knew construction at the university indicating the needs of operational integrity for university buildings.
* Oversees any outside vendors performing work on building systems.
* Participates with the Planning, QA and Regulatory Compliance division on load leveling and implementation of the preventative maintenance program for buildings and related equipment.

  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift** Day
  

**Work Arrangement**
  

**FLSA** Exempt
  

**Grade** 06

**Annual Minimum Salary** 75382.00
  

**Annual Mid Range Salary** 93917.00
  

**Annual Maximum Salary** 112452.00
  

**Standard Hours** 37.50

Rutgers also offers a benefit program to eligible full-time postdoctoral fellow students. For details, please go to https://finance.rutgers.edu/healthcare-risk/insurance/postdoctoral-health-insurance.

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field; Or the equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
* A minimum of five (5) years of experience in supervision of building maintenance systems (electrical, mechanical operations and repair).


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
* Must possess and maintain a valid driver’s license and be willing to travel, when necessary, to sites throughout New Jersey for business demands.
  


  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Must possess excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills.
* Must be proficient in the use of computerized maintenance management systems, as well as Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel.
* Must be knowledgeable of building codes and experienced in troubleshooting mechanical, electrical, and building systems.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with computerized maintenance, time and attendance and purchasing systems.
* Experience in a union environment.
* Knowledge of the University purchasing system Equipment Utilized.
* Computer proficiency and experience in Windows, email, and Microsoft Office particularly Excel.
